1982.subject: BIO
1982.descrlong:
Examines the diverse world of fungi in terrestrial ecosystems. Fungi are ecologically and econonomically important decomposers, symbionts and pathogens. Introduces current fungal research topics (e.g. pathogenicity) and explore both next generation sequencing technologies for the analysis of fungal diversity, growth and virulence mechanisms.

[Prereq: BIO 311 and (BIO 320 or BIO 322)]
